column4: i dual boot ubuntu/winxp. past few days ive noticed some strange file space issues...i opened up disk usage analyzer...says total filesystem usage 29.4g....this is ONLY including the ubuntu partition correct?
no, that must include your home files too, no way can that be just the filesystem
home files?
your user files
did you install /home on a separate partition? or just install everything to one partition
you probably installed everything to one partition especially if it is 29GB worth of files
yeah, it's all one partition, one for ubuntu one for win
in that case all your files and system files are included in that 29gb stuff
have you emptied the trash?
yeah
I find it hard to believe that the HD is corrupted, but I guess it isn't impossible
ahh, brasero, say no more
you have a brasero problem, not a hd corruption problem
use k3b it will pull in some kde dependencies, but it is worth it
sudo apt-get install k3b
that's my plan, but i'm still trying to figure out why it's saying i have less space after i cleared more space
because brasero probably has some tmp files somewhere eating space, reboot should clear that.
already rebooted
I have run into this before, but don't remember what happened, you are going to have to find the braser junk and delete it
losher can help you
but thanks for clarifying that my initial concerns were probably on mark and making me feel like i i took the appropriate steps
no prob
it will be in a file called du,out
ahh, there was an issue with trash not being emptied too, that is probably it
